KeywordList: Coronary artery disease, Exercise-based cardiac rehabilitation, Aerobic exercise.

Journal.Title: JPMA. The Journal of the Pakistan Medical Association

Article.ArticleTitle: Frequency, intensity and duration of routine rehabilitation exercises practiced by patients with coronary artery disease.

AbstractText: To determine the frequency, intensity and duration of routine rehabilitation exercises practiced by patients with coronary artery disease.

The cross-sectional descriptive study was conducted from February to June 2019 in different hospitals of Lahore, Pakistan, and comprised coronary artery disease patients of either gender aged 35-65 years. Data was collected using an interview-based questionnaire. Data was analysed using SPSS 25.

Of the 186 subjects, 105(56.5%) were males and 81(43.5%) were females. Overall, 72(38.7%) subjects were aged 52-62 years. Of the total, 117(62.9%) subjects practiced brisk walking as their routine rehabilitation exercise; 57(48.7%) doing it 3 times per week. All of these 117(100%) subjects practiced it for 10-20 minutes.
Brisk walking was mostly practiced by coronary artery disease patients for 10-20 minutes 3 times per week.
